Coefficient of Variation

The coefficient of variation (CV) is a measure of relative variability calculated as the ratio of the standard deviation to the mean of a dataset. It is expressed as a percentage to make it more interpretable. The formula for calculating CV is: CV = œÉ / Œº √ó 100

Key Concepts:

  • central tendency
  • measure of dispersion
  • covariance and correlation
  • probability distribution function
  • standardization and normalization
  • central limit theorem
  • population and sample
  • hypothesis testing
  • exploratory data analysis
  • Interquartile range
